The characteristics of Mr. Taylor's writings are, in his poema, ease of expression, with a careful selection of poetical capabilities, a full, ani- mated style, with a growing attention to art and condensation. His prose is equable and clear, in the flowing style, the narrative of a genial, healthy observer of the many manners of the world which he saw in the most remarkable portions of the four quarters.

Mr. Taylor was twice married, the second time in Germany. In 1877 he was appointed by President Hayes United States Minister to Berlin, and while serving in this capacity died December 19th, 1878.
